alert.note: Alert for Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 11:14AM CDT until October 12 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Marengo and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1114 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Demopolis, Linden, Uniontown, Cuba, Jefferson, Thomaston, Myrtlewood, Faunsdale, Dayton, Pin Hook, Chickasaw State Park, Dug Hill, Coatopa, Freddie Jones Field, Kinterbish, Consul, Demopolis Municipal Airport, U.S. 80 and AL 28, Demopolis Lock And Dam and Old Spring Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
